reviews.review_msg: Really interesting course and he explains it really well. The class consists of 2 short presentations, 1 paper and a final so the workload was not too bad. Totally recommend for a 400 level class.
Knows his stuff. Is willing to help if you see him. Overall quite a good prof.
Great prof really cares about students. material is tough but its a 4th year course
It was fun and useful class. Visiting office hour was very helpful.

His lectures are great, and while there were some issues with the assignment expectations, there was 
a great deal of grading leniency and he improved the criteria as the course went along. The other reviews for this course are little confusing as the class average was an A-.

Unfortunately, not helpful at all. His responses to questions were often vague or dismissive. Office hours didn't offer much support, and the lectures felt rushed or unclear. It seemed like we were expected to already understand the material. I don't recommend.

Kevin is a good performer, gregarious and could give interesting lectures. But he's not a very helpful professor. Expectations weren't clear and grading was ridiculous and inconsistent. He'll look like he's doing a good job, but in reality he's ineffective.

Don't take his class(es?) unless you're prepared to do everything with very little help. The entire experience was so stressful that by the end I started to question my own competence. I mentioned this to Kevin and felt completely dismissed. The grading is harsh for sure, and you're expected to know things that are not even listed as prerequisites.

Literally took another ECON class because he was teaching it, If that doesnt say how good of a prof he is, I dont know what. Provides clear feedback, takes time to learn everyone's name, and accessible after class. Would definitely recommend him to anyone that would take the course.

I don't normally rate profs but I need to here to save others a lot of trouble. Avoid like the plague! Horrible accent and quiet voice. All she does is bring printouts that she then re-writes on the overhead for some reason instead of just posting them online :S Assumes difficult concepts are easy. Oh yeah..no break in a 3 hour lecture either.
